TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi sealed beforefieldinit DescendantIterator extends System.ValueType

Docs.summary: Iterates over all descendant nodes according to the <xref:System.Xml.XPath> descendant axis rules.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Create (System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator input, System.Xml.Xsl.Runtime.XmlNavigatorFilter filter, bool orSelf);
.method public hidebysig instance void Create(class System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator input, class System.Xml.Xsl.Runtime.XmlNavigatorFilter filter, bool orSelf) cil managed

Docs.param: <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator> that identifies the node from which you start traversing descendants.

An instance of the <see cref="T:System.Xml.Xsl.Runtime.XmlNavigatorFilter"> class, which enables you to filter nodes based on the name. For more information, see <see cref="T:System.Xml.Xsl.Runtime.XmlNavigatorFilter">.
<see cref="T:System.Boolean"> that indicates whether the current node is returned as part of the iteration or filtered out.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The state of the navigator changes only if the <xref:System.Xml.Xsl.Runtime.DescendantIterator.MoveNext%2A> method has returned `true`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool MoveNext() cil managed

Docs.summary: Positions the iterator on the next descendant node.
Docs.returns: `true` if the next descendant node exists; otherwise, `false`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the next descendant node exists, the MoveNext method sets the <xref:System.Xml.Xsl.Runtime.DescendantIterator.Current%2A> property to the current result navigator; otherwise, the <xref:System.Xml.Xsl.Runtime.DescendantIterator.Current%2A> property remains unchanged.
